Global F tests and Family-Wise Error Rates
========================================================

Illustration of Global F tests being preferred over individual t-tests for $\hat\beta$s.

```{r}
nObs <- 1000
p <- 100
x <- matrix(rnorm(nObs*p), nrow=nObs)
x <- data.frame(1, x)
y <- rnorm(nObs)
colNames <- paste0("x", 1:(p+1))
colnames(x) <- colNames
fmla <- formula(paste0("y ~ 0 +", paste(colNames, collapse="+")))
mlr0 <- lm(y ~ x1, data=x)
mlr1 <- lm(fmla, data=x)
coefs <- summary(mlr1)$coef
sum(coefs[,"Pr(>|t|)"]<.05)
anova(mlr0, mlr1)
```
